Brown ground beef, sausage meat and onion. Cook till done and drain fat. Cut cheese into small chunks. Mix hamburger and all remaining ingredients in a crock pot. Turn on low and warm all. When thoroughly warmed through, serve with your favorite tortilla chips, toasted or grilled bread, corn chips, bagel chips, or whatever you like.

Preheat the oven to 375. Place the chicken, with the skins on, in a single layer in a shallow roasting dish and set aside. Heat the oil in a small saucepan and gently fry the green onions and garlic for about 2 minutes, until softened, but not browned. Add the honey, orange segments and soy sauce to the pan, stirring well and cook until the honey has completely dissolved. Pour the sauce over the chicken and bake, uncovered, for about 45 minutes, basting once or twice until the chicken is cooked.
Combine cheese and mayonnaise in medium bowl. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until the cheese is set. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350f. Combine cream cheese and cream, stirring until smooth. Stir in onion, horseradish, old bay, cheddar and chives. Add crabmeat with liquid and fold in gently. Place in a small baking dish, bake 8-10 minutes or until hot.

In a saucepan, melt butter. Stir in flour until smooth cook and stir over med heat for 2 minutes. Add cream, lemon juice, lemon zest and salt and pepper to taste. Simmer for at least 5 minutes but do not boil. Garnish with chopped parsley and very thin slices of carrot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease an 8x8 inch baking dish. Place the cranberries and brown sugar in the baking dish. Toss gently to combine. Cover and bake for 1 hour, stirring the mixture after about 30 minutes of baking time. After 1 hour baking remove from oven and stir in lemon juice, marmalade and chopped walunuts. Return to oven and bake uncovered for another 15 minutes. Cool to room temperature. Store any leftover conserve covered in the fridge.

Heat oil in a 4 quart saucepan on medium high heat. Add onion, carrots and garlic and cook, stirring occasionally until they are soft. Add beans, water, and seasonings. Stir and reduce heat to low and simmer for 30 minutes or until carrots are tender. Take half of soup and blend in blender until smooth. Return soup to bean mixture in pan and stir. Ladle into bowls and drizzle with olive oil before serving. Top with freshly grated parmesan cheese, if desired.

In a large mixing bowl, combine all ingredients except ice cream. Blend well. Add in the sugar. Beat on low for 2 minutes. Add in the milk, syrup, and vanilla. Beat 3-5 minutes until smooth and creamy. Use immediately or store, covered, at room temperature for up to 2 days. Reportedly, the icing tastes better if made the day before because the brown sugar gives the icing a slightly grainy texture that improves if allowed to set overnight.

Place chicken breast halves in a resealable plastic bag set in a shallow dish. For marinade, stir together lime peel, lime juice, cooking oil, salt, garlic cloves, salsa, lime wedgepreparation:Place chicken breast halves in a resealable plastic bag set in a shallow dish. For marinade, stir together lime peel, lime juice, cooking oil,

Place fish fillets in bottom of greased baking dish in one layer. Mix soup with sherry, salt, pepper, and basil. Spread this over fish. Sprinkle parmesan cheese over top. Bake at 350 f for 20-30 minutes until fish flakes. Garnish with lemon wedges and parsley.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cook beef in a large skillet until brown. Drain off extra fat. Stir in taco seasoning mix, tomato sauce, and corn. Sprinkle with cheese. Stir baking mix, milk, and eggs until blended and pour over beef mixture. Bake 35 minutes or until golden brown.

Heat olive oil in a small pan and fry chili for 3-4 minutes over a low heat. Stir in chopped red pepper. Drain sweet potato and garlic and mash with 2 tbsp cream cheese and milk, adding more if needed. Stir red pepper, chili and coriander into mash. Add salt and black pepper to taste.

Heat oil from tomatoes in a heavy skillet, over medium heat. Add chicken to skillet and saute until golden, about 4 minutes per side. Add garlic and stir 30 seconds--do not brown garlic. Add white wine, cream, pepper, and tomatoes, and bring to a boil. Cover skillet, reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer until chicken is just cooked through, about 3-5 minutes. Transfer chicken to plates. Add most of basil to sauce in skillet. Increase heat and boil until sauce thickens enough to coat spoon, and peppers and tomatoes are soft-about 2-5 minutes. Season sauce to taste with salt and pepper, spoon over chicken and top with fresh basil and serve.

In a medium saucepan combine all ingredients. Bring to a light simmer over medium heat. Reduce heat to low and simmer stirring for 5 minutes. The last 30 minutes of cooking the ham remove from oven and baste with the sauce. Continue to cook uncovered for 30 minutes.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Remove all visible fat from pork. Place in a shallow baking pan. In a small bowl, whisk together remaining ingredients except sesame seeds and onions. Brush honey mixture over pork. Sprinkle with sesame seeds. Bake uncovered for 45 minutes. To serve, slice thinly and garnish with green onions.

Cream butter until light. Gradually add sugars, creaming well until blended. Beat in vanilla and egg. Stir together flour, salt and soda. Add flour mixture to butter mixture, blending well. Stir in chips and crushed candy canes. Drop by level tablespoonfuls, 2 inches apart, onto cookie sheets covered with parchment paper. Bake at 375 degrees for about 12 minutes until golden. Remove to wire racks to cool.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees fahrenheit. Unroll crescent rolls into 4 rectangles and place in a 13 x 9 inch baking dish. Press up sides slightly and press perforations together. Layer cooked shrimp, cooked bacon, hash browns, and cheese. At this point you can make it ahead and refrigerate for up to 24 hours. Mix together eggs, milk, salt and pepper. Pour mixture over the dish. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes.

In a large skillet, melt butter over medium-low heat. Add carrots, onions, and ginger, cover and cook, stirring, for about 7 to 10 minutes, until just tender. Stir in the orange juice, jelly, and salt. Cook, uncovered, for about 4 minutes, stirring frequently, until vegetables are tender and nicely glazed with the jelly and orange juice mixture. Sprinkle with fresh chopped parsley just before serving.

Mix cream cheese and seafood salad. On a dinner sized plate, mold mixture into a ring, leaving room on outside of ring for crackers. Pour cream cheese in the middle of ring. Chill until served. Arrange cracker assortment around plate, outside of salad ring.

Mix together first 8 ingredients in a bowl. Shape mixture into 4 patties. Grill over medium-high heat for 10-12 minutes or until done, turning once. Just before taking off the grill, place cheese slice on each patty. Serve on buns with lettuce, tomato, etc.

Preheat oven to 350f. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs, salt, and pepper. In a separate bowl, whisk together the cream, mayonnaise, cheddar cheese, garlic powder, salt and pepper

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease and flour 8x8 baking pan and set aside. Combine flour, cornmeal, baking powder and salt in mixing bowl and set aside. Place margarine and sugar in large bowl of mixer and cream until smooth. Add honey and eggs and beat to blend, scraping bottom and sides of bowl frequently. Beat in half of the milk. Beat in half of the flour mixture. Repeat with remaining milk and flour mixture. With mixer at lowest speed, continue to mix for 4 minutes. Pour batter into prepared pan and bake in oven 50 to 60 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.
Preheat oven to 350f degrees. Bake for 30 to 45 minutes. Serve on buns.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl, combine the walnuts, soy sauce, ground cumin, tomatoes, cilantro, green onion, garlic clove, lemon, juice of, pepper, collard greens, and salt and pepper. Spread the nuts on a rimmed baking sheet and bake for 15 minutes., stirring occasionally, until browned. Season the nuts with salt and pepper and toss frequently until cooled.

Combine first 4 ingredients in a large bowl. Toss well. Combine sugar and remaining ingredients in a small bowl, stirring with a whisk. Pour vinegar mixture over cabbage mixture, tossing gently to combine. Cover. Chill 1 hour.
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add patties to pan and fry until brown, turning once. Serve on hamburger buns with lettuce, mayo and tomatoes or as desired.

Heat oven to 375 degrees. Spray bottom of baking dish with cooking spray, sprinkle three cups of the has browns in bottom of dish. Layer with ham cheese, bell peppers and mushrooms. Sprinkle remaining potatoes on top. Beat eggs and milk with wire wisk, add cottage cheese and pepper. Pour over mixture in baking pan. Bake 45 min or until golden brown and set in the center.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add butter and saute until butter is melted. Add parmesan cheese and saute until cheese is melted, about 2 minutes. Add milk and saute until cheese is melted, about 2 minutes. Add parmesan cheese and saute until cheese

Preheat oven to 350f line a baking sheet with parchment paper & set aside. Combine flour, oats, sugar, baking soda, salt and cinnamon in a medium bowl and stir with a fork to blend. Add butter and vanilla. Blend with fork until stiff dough forms. Add the egg white and beat with fork until stiff dough forms. Use your hands to mix in the raisins. Divide dough in half and place halves four inches apart on baking sheet. Bake until lightly browned. Remove sheet from oven & transfer the parchment to a cooling rack to cool for 15 minutes. Transfer cookies to wire rack and cool completely.

Preheat oven to 350f. Cut up the apples into small chunks and place them on the bottom of a lightly greased pie pan. Combine the sugar, flour, eggs and half of the vanilla into a bowl and mix well. Pour the mixture over the apples and sprinkle with remaining vanilla. Put into preheated oven for 20-30 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Meanwhile, combine cornstarch and water in a small bowl. In saucepan, melt chocolate and condensed milk over low heat, stirring occasionally. Add cornstarch mixture, then the eggs, butter, and salt. Stir until well-combined and smooth. Remove from the heat and add pecans. Mix well and pour into crust. Bake for approximately 30-35 minutes, until a knife inserted into the center of the pie comes out clean. Cool on a rack, then cover and refrigerate for a minimum of 2 hours.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f & grease a glass baking dish. Cook flat egg noodles in boiling water for 7 minutes, then drain & spoon noodles into prepared baking dish. Wisk together milk, sugar, cream cheese, eggs, nectar & melted butter, beating for 2 minutes. Stir in quartered apricots, then add mixture to noodles in baking dish. Bake about 60 minutes, until kugel is set & top is golden brown. Serve warm or cold.

Preheat oven to 350f. Cut ribs into serving sizes. Place in greased roasting pan. Bake uncovered for 45 minutes. In a saucepan combine the remaining ingredients. Bring to a boil, cook for one minute. Drain grease from ribs. Pour sauce over ribs. Cover and bake 1 hour. Uncover, bake for 30 minutes longer, basting twice.

Heat oil on medium high heat in large skillet or frying pan. Preheat oven to 300 degrees. Combine dry ingredients. Moisten chicken pieces with water. Dredge chicken in flour and crumb mixture. Quickly fry chicken on all sides until browned and crisp. Place in covered baking dish and bake additional 20-30 minutes to re-crisp chicken, serve.
Preheat oven to 350f. Place biscuits on a baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes or until golden brown.

Spray a slow cooker container with butter-flavored cooking spray. Combine apples and raisins in crock. Add splenda, apple pie spice, and apple juice. Mix well to combine. Dot top with margarine. Cover and cook on low for 4-6 hours.

Place the tomatoes in a blender or food processor. Blend either coarse or smooth, depending on your preference. Transfer tomatillo salsa to covered container and refrigerate at least 3 hours. Good with tortilla chips, enchiladas, tacos, etc. I always triple the recipe and freeze in 8 ounce containers.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease two 9x5-inch loaf pans. Combine all ingredients in a large bowl and mix well. Beat for an additional 2 minutes. Pour into pans and bake for an hour or till a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place the bottom crust in your pie plate. Cook the spinach, drain it, and chop it finely. Saute the chopped onion in a little cooking spray. Mix together the spinach, the onion, and the rest of the ingredients. Pour the mixture into the pie crust. Add the top crust and seal. Bake for 30-40 minutes.

Place greens in a bowl. Add sweet red peppers, feta cheese, red wine vinegar, granulated sugar, cayenne. Toss thoroughly. Taste, and add more oil if desired. Scatter olives & feta cheese over the top and serve.

Place the fruit in a large glass bowl and pour the wine mixture on top. Toss gently. Cover and refrigerate for 2 hours. Using a slotted spoon transfer fruit to large glass goblets. Drizzle with desired amount of marinating liquid. Garnish glass rims with lemon and tangerine slices.

Heat oil in skillet, add onion, pepper, tomatoes, cilantro, garlic and tomato paste. Cook for 10 minutes. Bring sauce to a boil, then add shrimp and lemon juice. Reduce heat to medium and cook for 2 minutes. Add coconut milk and stir-fry 3-4 minutes until shrimp are pink and opaque. Add cilantro. Toss well and transfer to serving plates. Top each serving with 1 tablespoon toasted coconut and 1 tablespoon chopped peanuts. Garnish with lime wedges.

Mix sugar, evaporated milk and butter in large saucepan. Stir constantly over medium heat and bring to a full boil. Stir 4 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in peanut butter, vanilla and marshallow. Spread in pan. Cool completely and cut into squares.

Heat oil in a 4 quart saucepan on medium high heat. Add onion, carrots and garlic and cook, stirring occasionally until they are soft. Add beans, water, and seasonings. Stir and reduce heat to low and simmer for 30 minutes or until noodles are tender. Take half of soup and blend in blender until smooth. Return soup to bean mixture in pan and stir. Ladle into bowls and drizzle with olive oil before serving. Top with freshly grated parmesan cheese, if desired.
Beat butter until creamy. Add sugar, mix well. Now mix in vanilla, water, and cocoa. Mix in oats. Roll in to 1 inch balls and sprinkle with powdered sugar. Eat and keep refrigerated.

Preheat oven to 250f. In a large bowl combine the cereal, oyster crackers, pretzels, pistachios and cheese. In a small bowl combine the butter, salad dressing mix, and garlic powder. Drizzle over the cereal mix, tossing to lightly coat mixture. Place on a cookie or baking sheet and bake for 30 minutes. Remove from oven, stir in dry fruit, and spread mixture on buttered foil to cool. Break into bite size pieces and store in airtight container.

Heat oil in large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion, carrots and garlic and cook, stirring occasionally until onion is translucent, stirring occasionally. Add tomatoes with their liquid, pinto beans, lima beans, brown sugar, salt and water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer 15 minutes or until lima beans are tender, stirring occasionally. Stir in white kidney beans, heat through. To serve, ladle soup into warm serving bowl. Sprinkle with 1 to 2 ounces shredded cheddar cheese if desired.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Chop onions and slice mushrooms. Melt margarine in skillet. Saute onions until transparent. Add mushrooms. Cover and cook 10 minutes. Allow to cool. Mix together egg, flour, non-dairy milk and wine. Salt and pepper to taste. Pour into pie crust. Form lattice strips from second crust and place on top of quiche. Bake for 2 minutes.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Mix oil, and seasonings in a large bowl. Add chicken and potatoes. Roast in oven for 30 minutes or until chicken is cooked through and potatoes are tender, turning potatoes occasionally.

In a large skillet sprayed with butter-flavored cooking spray, brown meat and onion. Add mushroom soup, mushrooms, black pepper, noodles, nonfat sour cream, parsley. Mix well to combine. Simmer 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in sour cream and parsley. Serve at once.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Coat 8 muffin cups with pam. Mix sugar and cinnamon in small bowl. Dip each marshmallow in melted margarine and roll in sugar mix. Separate dough into triangles. Wrap one triangle around each marshmallow and pinch dough together. Place each one in a muffin cup. Drizzle extra margarine over rolls. Bake 8-12 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Cream together butter and sugar until smooth. Add eggs and vanilla, mixing well. In a separate bowl, mix flour, baking soda, and salt. Add to creamed mixture. Drop by heaping tablespoonfuls onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees f. For 11-14 minutes or until light golden. Transfer cookies to wire rack to cool.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray muffin pan with cooking spray. Beat sugar and eggs together until thickened. Add melted butter and almond extract. Beat well. Add flour. Stir in cranberries and pecans. Fill muffin pan. Since these do not raise much fill the cups to the top. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes or until browned on top and done in center. Cool on wire rack.

Combine apples and cinnamon. Place cheese on the outside of 4 slices of toast. Spoon apples onto cheese. Top with remaining bread slices. Brush outside with butter. Broil on each side until golden brown.

Melt butter in a heavy saucepan over medium high heat. Add milk, stir and return to stove over medium high heat. Cook 2 minutes. Remove pan from burner, add milk, stir and return to stove over medium high heat. Cook, stirring constanly, until mixture comes to a boil. Reduce heat to medium and cook 2 minutes, stirring constantly, adding more milk if the sauce becomes too thick. Season with salt and pepper, add chopped egg and mix.

Preheat oven to 400f. Pulse olives, vegetables, and oil in a food processor until chopped, add a bit of the stuffed olive brine if salad needs it. Brush cut sides of the focaccia with vinegar and sprinkle with oregano. Layer meats and cheese on the bottom half of the bread. Top with olive salad and the other half of the bread. Wrap in foil and bake until heated through, about 30 minutes. Slice into quarters, then cut each quarter in half diagonally, and serve.

Place peach and lavender jam in a large bowl and bring to a boil, stirring. Boil for one minute, stirring constantly. Add to fruit mixture. Stir for 3 minutes. Ladle into freezer containers, seal and process in a boiling water bath for 10 minutes. Place hot jars on a towel on your counter and let cool overnight. Remove from heat, stir in the pectin and ladle into hot sterilized jars. Seal and process in a hot water bath for 10 minutes. Seal and process

Combine all the ingredients in a sauce pan, bring to a boil and simmer 10 minutes, cool a bit. Place the slabs of ribs in a large plastic bag and pour in the sauce, turn to coat the ribs and seal the bag. Marinate in the fridge for at least an hour. Remove ribs from the marinade and reserve the marinade. Place ribs over medium heat and grill for 50-60 minutes turning the ribs and basting with the marinade during the last 20 minutes of cooking.

Place tomato halves cut-sides down directly on greased broiler or grill rack. Broil until they start to char and blister, about 4 minutes. Using tongs or a spatula and spoon, carefully turn tomatoes over and broil or grill 2 minutes more. Remove cooked tomatoes from heat and place cut-sides up in the dish with oil and vinegar mixture. Spoon some of the mixture over tomatoes. Set aside to marinate at least 1 hour, or cover and refrigerate up to 5 days. Serve at room temperature.

Heat butter over medium-high heat until melted. Add mushrooms, sauting 3 minutes. Add 2 cups of half and half, salt, and pepper, stirring for 5 minutes, but do not let it boil. Slowly add parmesan and pesto. Heat through and serve over fettuccine.

In a large bowl, combine the warm water, buttermilk, vegetable oil, sugar, baking soda, salt. Cover and process on low speed for 30 seconds or until blended. In a large bowl, combine the flour and salt. Add the yeast mixture and stir with a spoon until combined. Cover and let rise in a warm place until doubled in size, about 30 minutes. Stir dough down. Fill greased muffin cups half full. Cover and let rise in a warm place

In a food processer or blender, put in white wine, olive oil, lemon, juice of, lime, juice of, sea salt, dry oregano, crushed red pepper flakes, garlic cloves, lemon, juice of, sea salt, dry oregano, crushed red pepper flakes, garlic cloves, lemon, juice of, sea salt, dry oregano, crushed red pepper flakes, garlic cloves, lemon, juice of, sea salt, dry oregano, crushed red pepper flakes, garlic cloves, lemon, juice of, sea salt, dry oregano, crushed red pepper flakes, garlic cloves, lemon, juice of, sea salt, dry oregano, crushed red pepper flakes, garlic cloves, lemon, juice of, sea salt, dry oregano, crushed red pepper flakes, garlic cloves, lemon, juice of, sea salt, dry oregano, crushed red pepper flakes, garlic cloves, lemon, juice of, sea salt, dry oregano, crushed red pepper flakes, garlic cloves, lemon, juice of, sea salt, dry oregano, crushed red pepper flakes, garlic cloves, lemon, juice of, sea salt, dry oregano, crushed red pepper flakes, garlic cloves, lemon, juice of, sea salt, dry oregano, crushed red pepper flakes, garlic cloves, lemon, juice of, sea salt, dry oregano, crushed red pepper flakes, garlic cloves, lemon, juice of, sea salt, dry oregano, crushed red pepper flakes, garlic cloves, lemon, juice of, sea salt, dry oregano, crushed red pepper flakes, garlic cloves, lemon, juice of, sea salt, dry oregano, crushed red pepper flakes, garlic cloves, lemon, juice of, sea salt, dry oregano, crushed red

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion slices and saute until onion is tender. Add cabbage and stir until cabbage is well coated with the bacon mixture. Pour beer into a 2 cup measuring cup add caraway seeds, mustard, sugar, salt and pepper and stir until well mixed. Mixture might get foamy. Pour over the cabbage in the skillet and mix well with an egg spatula. Cover with a lid and simmer until cabbage is tender.

Heat olive oil over medium heat. Saut crushed garlic for 1-2 minutes. Stir in tomato sauce. Add salt, pepper, and pesto. Add cream cheese and stir well until fully melted. Stir parmesan cheese until melted. Add cream and stir well.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cut 4 pieces of tinfoil big enough to wrap everything up. Slice one potato into thin slices and place on a piece of tinfoil. Top with some sliced mushrooms and onions, to your taste. Sprinkle with a pinch of garlic salt and thyme. Top with 1 tbs butter. Wrap tinfoil tightly around. Repeat with remaining potatoes. Place potato packets in oven. Bake 30-40 minutes or until potatoes are tender.

Mix cream cheese, butter, sugar, and vanilla with mixer until smooth. Spread into a deep pie dish. Spread caramel topping on top, then sprinkle with toffee bits and nuts. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Just before serving, core and cut apples into wedges and arrange around the edge of the pie dish, alternating red and green slices.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray a loaf pan with cooking spray. In a bowl gently mix all your ingredients until well combined. Transfer meat mixture in loaf pan and gently press down. Bake until internal temperature reaches 180 degrees, about 1 hour and 15 minutes. As an option you can brush the top of the meatloaf with a little extra wing sauce when you pull it out of the oven to give it a better appearance.

Heat a small non-stick skillet over medium-high heat until hot. Add whole tomato to skillet and heat until skin is blistered and slightly charred, turning frequently. Cool tomato slightly and coarsely chop. In a large saucepan, combine tomato, onion, and garlic. Cook over medium heat until onion and garlic are softened, about 5 minutes. Stir in beans and broth, and bring to a boil. Reduce heat, simmer 15 to 20 minutes. Meanwhile, heat oven to 425f cut tortillas into strips and place in a single layer on a large baking sheet. Bake for 5 to 8 minutes or until crisp. To serve, ladle soup into bowls and top with tortilla strips and cheese.

Preheat oven to 400f. Spray an 8-inch pie plate with vegetable cooking spray. In a large bowl combine egg with melted butter. Whisk until well combined. Sift together flour, sugar, baking soda, baking powder and salt in a small bowl. Combine with egg mixture. Pour in buttermilk and stir until just combined.

In a large nonstick saut pan over medium heat, combine cooked rice and whole milk. Heat until mixture begins to boil. Decrease heat to low and cook to a simmer, stirring frequently, until mixture just begins to thicken, approximately 5 minutes. Increase heat to medium, add heavy cream, coconut milk, sugar, and cardamom. Continue to cook until mixture just begins to thicken again, approximately 5-10 minutes. Use a whisk to prevent the cardamom from clumping. Once mixture begins to thicken, remove from heat and stir in raisins and pistachios. Transfer the mixture to individual serving dishes or a glass bowl and place plastic wrap directly on the surface of the pudding. Serve chilled or at room temperature. I like my rice pudding a little sweet, so i also added a little bit more sugar than the 2 oz. Called for in the recipe to suit my personal taste.

Preheat oven to 375f. Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil. In a small bowl, combine acorn squash, sweet potatoes, leeks, skinless chicken thighs, salt & fresh ground pepper, orange marmalade, reduced-sodium chicken broth, orange juice, hoisin sauce, maple syrup. Toss to coat sweet potatoes thoroughly. Spread sweet potatoes onto foil-lined baking sheet into a single layer, leaving two spaces in the middle for the pork chops. Roast for 35-40 minutes or until pork chops are done.

In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter until smooth. Add in the sugar. Beat on low for 2 minutes. Add in the milk, syrup, and vanilla. Beat 3-5 minutes until smooth and creamy. Use immediately or store, covered, at room temperature for up to 2 days. Reportedly, the icing tastes better if made the day before because the brown sugar gives the icing a slightly grainy texture that improves if allowed to set overnight.

Preheat oven to 350f. Cream butter, sugars and eggs until smooth. Combine flour, salt and baking soda together in a separate bowl. Mix wet ingredients with dry ingredients, and lastly stir in the oats and chocolate chips. Form into small balls with hands and bake on cookie sheets lined with parchment paper for 8-10 minutes or until very light golden, they should almost look un-cooked. Store in a tupperware box to keep them chewy.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees f. Place chicken in baking dish. Combine mustard, honey, butter, dijon mustard, curry powder, red cayenne pepper and cayenne. Mix well to combine. Pour over the chicken pieces in the baking dish. Mix the chicken pieces slightly with your hands to coat. Bake uncovered for 20 minutes. Remove from oven. Turn the chicken pieces over. With a spoon, baste with sauce. Bake for another 25 minutes or until chicken is cooked.
In a large pot of boiling salted water, cook orzo 5 minutes. Add sugar snap peas and squash. Cook until orzo is al dente and vegetables are crisp-tender, about 3 minutes. Drain well. Return to pot.

Heat oven to 350f. Cook beef, stirring occasionally until brown. Drain off fat. Stir in rice, soup, chilies, and taco seasoning mix. Spoon into 12 x 8-inch baking pan. Top with tomatoes cheese and corn chips. Bake for 30-35 minutes or until heated through.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix ingredients together in a large bowl until well-blended. Roll peanut butter mixture into tablespoon size balls. Bake 12 minutes for chewy cookies. Bake 15 minutes for crisp.

In a large saucepan, combine salted mango and banana with onion, peanut oil, mango, white vinegar, orange juice, banana, ginger, raisins, brown sugar, serrano chili. Place pan over high heat and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover and simmer for 50 minutes., or until mango are soft. Remove pan from heat. Ladle chutney into clean, warm jam jars. Seal and label, store in cool dark place until ready to use.

Preheat oven to 325f. In a large mixing bowl, cream your butter and sugars til fluffy and airy. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Stir in flour mixture until combined well drop by quarter cup measure on to an ungreased baking sheet. Bake 12 to 13 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from baking sheet and then cool on a wire rack.

Heat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. In a medium mixing bowl, combine butter, onion, cooked ham, egg noodles, salt, pepper, caraway seed, egg yolks, salt, vegetable oil, water. Mix together the wet ingredients and pour into well. Mix well. Turn out onto a floured board and knead until firm, shiny and elastic. At this point cover and chill for 1 hour, up to 24 hours. When ready to use follow instructions for manual pasta machine or cut into manageable pieces and roll out to desired thickness, cut into desired shape. Bake at 350 degrees fahrenheit for 20 to 30 minutes. Garnish with paprika or parsley.

In a large frying pan, fry bacon until crisp. Remove bacon and drain. Add salt and pepper to taste maybe a little more butter, not much. Slice sausage and lay on top of cabbage. Continue to cook a little longer to warm the sausage. Crumble bacon over all. Yummmy -- great with black eyed-peas and cornbread.

If using larger than cherry or grape tomatoes, cut them in segments about the same size as your shrimp. In a medium bowl, combine tomatoes & basil. Season with salt & pepper. Set aside. Rinse, drain & pat shrimp dry. Heat a large saute pan or skillet over medium heat. When hot, add shrimp and saute for about 1 minute. Add shrimp and garlic to bowl of tomatoes & basil, and toss well. May be served hot.
Heat oil in pan over medium heat. Add garlic, stir until well blended 5 minute. Add beef brisket and saute 8 min., add mushrooms, saute additional 3 minute., add mushrooms, saute additional

Heat grill to high. Melt butter in a frying pan and fry mushrooms until tender. Add garlic and thyme and cook for another minute. Toast the bread, top with the mushrooms and then the cheese. Grill until cheese is brown and bubbly.

In a large skillet sprayed with butter-flavored cooking spray, saute celery and onion for 6 to 8 minutes or until just tender. Stir in rice and corn. In a small bowl, combine dry milk powder and water. Add milk mixture to the celery mixture. Mix well to combine. Stir cheddar cheese, parmesan cheese, parsley flakes and lemon pepper into celery mixture. Lower heat and simmer for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.

Place the cake mix and pudding mix in a large bowl and stir well. Add the mandarin oranges in their liquid and the egg substitute. Beat for about 2 minutes or until the mixture is smooth and the oranges are pureed. Spray a 12-cup bundt pan well and spread batter evenly. Bake for 35-40 minutes, until the top springs back when touched and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Allow cake to cool in the pan for 45 minutes, then invert onto a platter. Sprinkle powdered sugar on top, if desired. Sprinkle powdered sugar

Heat 1 tablespoon of the oil and half of the butter in a large, non-stick frying pan over a medium heat. Spread the flaked coconut over a small plate. Sprinkle 2 slices of bread with chocolate, and top each with another slice. Dip sandwiches into egg mixture, then press into the almonds, to coat. Heat 1 tablespoon of the oil and half of the butter in a large, non-stick frying pan over a medium heat. Heat 1 tablespoon of the oil

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Place chicken in glass baking dish. In a small bowl, combine the remaining ingredients and whisk together until well blended and smooth. Pour sauce mixture over chicken. Bake chicken with sauce mixture for about 20 - 30 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. For best results turn chicken over half way through cooking.

Preheat oven to 375f. Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil. In a small bowl, combine paprika, cumin, cayenne pepper, black pepper and salt. Divide in half. In a medium bowl, combine half of spice mixture, sweet potatoes, olive oil and maple syrup. Toss to coat sweet potatoes thoroughly. Spread sweet potatoes onto foil-lined baking sheet into a single layer, leaving two spaces in the middle for the collard greens. Roast for 35-40 minutes or until collard greens are done.

Combine all ingredients, except bratwursts, butter, cold water, flour, salt, sour cream. Bring to a boil to melt butter& combine well. Remove from heat. Stir in bratwursts, butter, cold water, flour, salt, sour cream. Stir in brat

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Spread dijon on chops. Sprinkle rosemary, salt and pepper. Turn to other side and repeat. Place breadcrumbs on shallow dish. Coat chops on both sides in crumbs. Heat skillet on medium high heat. Drizzle small amount of olive oil. Heat. Brown chops for a couple of minutes on each side. Place chops in oven. Cook for 20 minutes.

Preheat oven to 450. In small mixing bowl, combine cooking spray, seafood seasoning, baking potatoes, salmon fillets, and salt. In 13 x 9 glass baking dish, toss potatoes with onion, olive oil, pepper, and 1 tbsp of the chili mixture until evenly coated. Cover with foil and roast 20 minutes. Meanwhile, use remaining chili mixture to coat salmon fillets. Place on top of potatoes, skin side down, and roast uncovered 10-12 minutes, or until fish flakes easily and potatoes are tender.

Heat oil in a heavy skillet over high heat until hot but not smoking, then brown tenderloin on all sides about 10 minutes. Transfer pan to oven and roast until thermometer inserted diagonally 2 inches into center of meat registers 120 degrees, 25-30 minutes. Transfer beef to a cutting board and let stand 15 minutes. Temperature of meat will rise to about 130 degrees. Discard string and rosemary sprigs before slicing.

Combine the cabbage, carrot, cilantro, lime juice, apple cider vinegar, salt, chili powder, sugar, salt and pepper. Whisk to combine. Cover and allow the slaw to sit for at least 30 minutes, tossing every so often to combine well. Top with raisins before serving.

In a large saucepan, saute the onions and garlic in 3 tablespoons of oil for 5 minutes, until limp, then add the last tablespoon of oil and the potatoes and stir-fry for a minute. Add the stock, cover, and simmer for 45 minutes, until the potatoes are mushy. Remove from heat and puree. Return the soup to the pot, season with salt and cayenne, and stir in the chopped cilantro. You can serve the soup cold--or reheat by slowly bringing it to a simmer. Ladle into soup plates and top with a sprinkling of cilantro or chives.

Heat the butter over medium-high heat until butter is melted. Add the mushrooms and saut, stirring until golden brown and butter has been absorbed. Add salt, pepper and flour. Mix thoroughly. Add milk gradually and simmer for 5 to 8 minutes, stirring constantly.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion and cook for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add garlic and cook for another 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add salt and pepper and cook for another 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add lemon juice and cook for another 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add salt and pepper

In a large saucepan over medium heat, combine milk, sugar and salt. Bring to a boil and stir in gelatin. Boil 4 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in butter, chocolate chips, vanilla and cherries. Pour into prepared pan. Chill 2 hours before serving.

Cook pasta until al dente. Add pasta and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink inside. Reduce heat and stir in salt, pepper, cream, pesto, and parmesan cheese. Cook until chicken is no longer pink inside. Cook until chicken is no longer pink

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 12-cup muffin tin with butter and set aside. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, salt and baking soda. Add the butter and rub it into the flour with your finger. Add the buttermilk and stir until the dough is slightly firm. Spoon the mixture into the prepared muffin tin and bake in the center of the oven till brown and crusty, 40-45 minutes.

Combine all ingredients in a large saucepan. Bring to a simmer. Simmer for 20 minutes to allow the spices to permeate the liquid. Ladle into mugs. Leftovers will keep in the refrigerator 2 to 3 days. Rewarm in the microwave.

Heat oven to 400 degrees f. In a food processor, combine the cheese and butter. Process until the mixture is smooth. Add the scallions and pulse until combined. Season with salt and pepper, to taste. Spread the cheese mixture on the cut sides of the bread. Place on a baking sheet and bake for 10 to 12 minutes until golden. Remove from oven and serve immediately.

In a large skillet sprayed with butter-flavored cooking spray, brown meat and onion. Add butter, onion, garlic cloves, sliced mushrooms, fresh ground black pepper, kosher salt, nutmeg, beef bouillon cube, sour cream. Mix well to combine. Simmer 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Sim

Put chocolate chips and butterscotch chips in the saucepan. Put the saucepan on the burner and turn on the stove to low. Stir and stir until the mixture is melted and smooth. Remove saucepan from heat. Turn off the burner and quickly add the chow mein noodles and the peanuts. Mix and stir until they are evenly coated. Cover the cookie sheets with wax paper. Drop the candy by teaspoonfuls onto the wax paper-covered cookie sheets. Put the cookie sheets into the refrigerator to cool the candies. When they are cool, take them off the waxed paper. Put them in plastic bags. Keep them in the refrigerator to cool the candies. Keep them in plastic bags. Keep them

Heat 1 tbs oil in a saucepan and fry onion and garlic for approx 2 minute, making sure not to brown the paste. Add hot water. Wash the lentils and put into the water. Add salt and tsp of turmeric. Bring to a boil then lower heat and cook for 10 to 15 minutes, stirring once or twice. Heat oil in another saucepan and fry onion till golden, about 2-3 minutes. Add remaining ingredients and stir. Bring to a boil and then reduce the heat to a simmer. Cook uncovered until the lentils are tender, about 45 minutes. Serve warm with italian crusty bread or flatbreads.

Scoop the avocado out of the skin into a bowl. Coarsely mash with fork or potato masher. Add all other ingredients except the lime juice. Lightly blend - authentic guac is chunky, not pureed. Squeeze in lime juice, mix gently and taste for seasoning adjustments.

In a large bowl, mix the tuna lightly with the green beans, onion, chicken broth, frozen italian cut green beans, instant rice, basil, pepper, tuna, cherry tomatoes. Season well with salt and pepper. Divide the salad leaves between two plates. Season lightly. Pile tuna salad on top. Drizzle over the olive oil and lemon juice. Sprinkle with chili powder. Serve with toasted bread.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees f. Stir together oil & garlic, then using a pastry brush, brush one side of each bread slice with the oil mixture. Place bread slices on a baking sheet & bake about 10 minutes or until tops of bread slices are golden brown. Meanwhile, in medium bowl, toss together eggs, apple, walnuts & salad dressing. Top each toasted bread slice with some of the peaches, roma tomatoes, garlic clove, red wine vinegar, fresh basil, salt & freshly ground black pepper, baguette. Serve immediately.

Place the steak on broiler pan and cook until tender. Sprinkle with flour. Stir until blended. Gradually add milk. Bring to a boil. Cook and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened. Add blue cheese, wine or chicken broth, white pepper and pepper sauce. Heat through. Serve sauce over meat.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place macaroni, cream cheese, ham, cheddar cheese, spring onions, black pepper, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts, macadamia nuts

Cook rice according to package directions. To prepare the beans, heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add onions and saute until tender. Sprinkle on chili powder and cook 1 minute, stirring frequently. Add beans, salsa, and water and cook about 5 minutes. Serve beans over rice, with sour cream on top.

Scoop the avocado out of the skin into a bowl. Coarsely mash with fork or potato masher. Add all other ingredients except the lime juice. Lightly blend - authentic guac is chunky, not pureed. Squeeze in lime juice, mix gently and taste for seasoning adjustments.

Preheat oven to 475f. In large roasting pan, combine potatoes, onion, garlic, oil, salt, pepper and rosemary and toss to coat. Roast veggies 25 minutes, stirring once. Lightly salt and pepper chicken and add, tossing to coat and roast 15 minutes longer or until chicken is done. Place spinach over chicken mixture and roast for 5 minutes longer or until chicken is done

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Brush the 1 tbsp melted butter into a square baking dish. Beat the eggs, sour cream, milk and mustard together until well blended. Stir in the scallions, swiss cheese, salt and paprika. Pour into the buttered baking dish. Bake at 325 for about 30-35 minutes or until eggs are set but still moist.

Preheat oven to 400. Brush a 13 x 9 inch baking dish with olive oil. Layer the sliced potatoes, mushrooms, and onions, in the dish. Sprinkle with the salt and sage leaves. Pour the cream over evenly. Brush the pork chops with olive oil, and rub the breadcrumbs onto both sides of each pork chop. Place pork chops on top of the vegetables. Bake, uncovered, for 45 minutes to 1 hour, or just until the pork chops are cooked through and the potatoes are tender.

To make the crust, mix the flour, sugar, and salt in a medium bowl. Using a pastry blender, cut in the shortening and butter until the mixture resembles coarse meal. Stirring with a fork, add just enough of the egg yolk mixture to moisten the dough so it holds together when pinched between the thumb and forefinger. Gather up into a thick disk and wrap in waxed paper. Refrigerate at least 30 minutes, or up to overnight.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Arrange sweet potatoes in an even layer in a 9-by-13-inch glass baking dish. Combine maple syrup, butter, lemon juice, salt and pepper in a small bowl. Pour the mixture over the sweet potatoes. Toss to coat. Cover and bake the sweet potatoes for 15 minutes. Uncover, stir and cook, stirring every 15 minutes, until tender and starting to turn brown, 45 to 50 minutes more.
In a large saucepan, saute the butter beans in oil until tender. Add the yogurt, brown sugar, molasses, dry mustard, salt and pepper. Cook and stir for 1 minute. Add the yogurt, brown sugar,

Place marinated veggie kabobs on skewers and place in shallow pan. Mix sweet-and-sour sauce with reserved pineapple juice and pour over kabobs. Grill or broil kabobs for 3 to 4 minutes on each side or until cooked. Baste often with sauce.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly grease an 8x8-inch baking dish. In a large mixing bowl, beat together milk, butter and egg substitute. Add the sugar, then gradually beat in the flour. Pour batter into prepared pan. Bake in preheated oven for 30 minutes. Cut into 16 square servings.

Place the potatoes in a bowl. Add seasonings and oil. Toss to coat well. Transfer to a large rimmed baking sheet. Bake in 400f oven, stirring 3 or 4 times, for 55 to 65 minutes or until golden and tender.

Preheat oven to 425f. In a food processor, combine flour tortillas, cooked chicken, onion, green chilies, chicken broth, cheddar cheese, cream of mushroom soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup

Mix the mustard seeds and spices in a bowl, pour the vinegar on top and leave to soak overnight. Place the mixture in a mortar and pound to a paste. Gradually work in the gerry cohen s mustard. The finished mustard should resemble a stiff paste, so add extra vinegar if necessary. Store the mustard in sterilized jars in the fridge. Use within 4 weeks.
Place chicken pieces on top of onion mixture, and cover with remaining onion mixture. Bake until chicken is done, approximately 45-55 minutes.
In casserole dish, mix together sauerkraut and chopped onion. Place sliced kielbasa over mixture. Bake uncovered at 400 degrees for 35-40 minutes.

Preheat oven to 425 f. Line a baking tray with parchment paper and set aside. Lay two spring roll wrappers on a clean work surface. Brush wrappers lightly with melted butter. Slice the bananas in half on the diagonal. Place one banana half in the lower third portion of the wrapper and cover with the chocolate. Sprinkle a little salt over the chocolate and top with the remaining banana half. Roll into a tight package. Continue until all bananas and wrappers are rolled. Place the finished banana rolls on the lined baking tray and brush tops and edges with butter. Bake for 5-7 minutes on the baking tray and serve when golden brown.

Preheat oven to 400f. Peel and cube squash. In a large bowl mix minced garlic and olive oil. Add cubed squash and coat with the oil mixture. Dump all ingredients out of bowl and in to a glass casserole dish. Any size will do really but it will cook faster if it is more spread out. Cook 40-45 minutes, stirring once or twice. Squash is done when it is tender.

Preheat oven to 400f. Spray an 8-inch pie plate with vegetable cooking spray. In a large bowl combine egg with melted butter. Whisk together flour, sugar, baking soda, baking powder and salt in a small bowl. Combine with egg mixture. Pour in buttermilk and stir until just combined. Pour

Place cucumbers in bowl. Add salt, toss and chill 1 hour. Drain cucumbers and return to bowl. Combine remaining ingredients in another bowl. Pour over cucumbers and toss to coat. Can be prepared 1 day ahead and refrigerated.

In a small bowl combine first 5 ingredients. Spray a small skillet with pam and head over medium heat. Add egg mixture to skillet, cooking until bottom of eggs is firm. Flip omelet and cook other side until set. Put cheese on one half of omelet and flip over other half. Cut in half to serve.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a mixing bowl, combine all dry ingredients, except pumpkin seeds, in a large mixing bowl and mix well. In a seperate bowl, slightly beat the eggs with a fork or wire whisk. Add thwe remaining wet ingredients to the eggs and stir well. Fold in chocolate chips. Coat 2 bread pans evenly with cooking spray. Pout half of the mixture into each pan. Bake for 50-60 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a large bowl, beat the margarine, white and brown sugar together until fluffy. Add eggs and vanilla, beat well. In another bowl, sift flour, baking powder, and salt. Add to the creamed mixture, stirring well. Fold in butter brickle bits, and chocolate chips. Spread in a greased 9x13-inch pan. Bake for 40 to 45 minutes or until brownies pull away from pan or until set in center. Cool completely before cutting into squares.

In a 4-cup measuring cup, heat 4 cups water in microwave to boiling. Place tea bags in water and let steep for 5- 10 minutes. Pour sugar into 2 quart pitcher and pour hot tea over it. Squeeze tea bags to get out any remaining tea. Add tea to pitcher and discard bags. Stir well. Chill until very cold and serve over ice with lemon.
Roast at 400 f, uncovered, 40 to 45 minutes. Baste twice with pan drippings. Place hens in single layer in shallow oiled pan. Roast at 400 f, uncovered, 40 to 45 minutes

Preheat oven to 350f. Spray cookie sheet with cooking spray. In a large bowl combine powdered sugar, powdered egg whites, warm water, food coloring. Mix in dry ingredients. Drop by tablespoonsful on ungreased cookies sheets, 2 inches apart, and bake in preheated 375 oven about 12 minutes, til tops are puffed and set. Cool on rack.

In a large skillet, combine all the ingredients except the potatoes and cheese over high heat. Mix well. Cook for 5 to 8 minutes, or until heated through, stirring frequently. Remove from the heat and and put into a deep cassarole dish. Dollop with the potatoes. Bake at 375 for 35 minutes. Cover with grated cheese last 10 minutes of cooking. Serve immediately.

In a medium size glass bowl mix together the tomatoes, jalapeno pepper, cilantro, onion, garlic, sugar, and salt and pepper. Combine well. Add in the juice. Cover and refrigerate for 3-4 hours before serving. Serve with fresh tortilla chips.
Heat grill to medium-high, cook shrimp for 2 to 3 minutes a side, basting with reserved sauce. Cook the shrimp until opaque. Be careful not to overcook.

Combine all ingredients and bring to soft ball stage, stirring constantly. Remove from heat. Stir until mixture thickens, becomes creamy and cloudy, and pecans stay suspended in mixture. Spoon out on aluminum foil or parchment paper. Makes approximately fifteen to twenty pralines, depending on size.

Mix all ingredients together in blender. Pour into 6- 3oz molds or paper cups. Freeze for one hour, place sticks in the middle. Freeze for another 3 hours, until solid. To release pops, dip molds into hot water until pops loosen and slide out. If using paper cups, peel away paper.

Preheat oven to 350f line a baking sheet with parchment paper & set aside. Combine flour, oats, sugar, baking soda, salt and cinnamon in a medium bowl and stir with a fork to blend. Add butter and vanilla. Blend with fork until stiff dough forms. Use your hands to mix in the raisins. Divide dough in half and place halves four inches apart on baking sheet. Bake until lightly browned. Remove sheet from oven & transfer the parchment to a cooling rack to cool for 15 minutes. Transfer cookies to wire rack and cool completely.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place all ingredients into a large mixing bowl and mix until just moistened. Spoon into lined or nonstick, sprayed mini muffin pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes. Remove muffins from the tray and cool on a wire rack.

Heat oven to 400 f. Combine the oil, garlic, sugar, cumin, salt, cinnamon, and carrots in a shallow baking pan. Roast 20 minutes or until fork-tender. Remove from oven and add the raisins, lemon juice, and parsley. Toss well. Remove from oven and add the salt and pepper to your own personal preference.

Fill a glass with ice cubes. To a cocktail shaker, add the vodka, rum, gin, tequila, blue curacao, lemon juice, and simple syrup. Shake vigorously for 5-10 seconds. Pour into the glass. Add in the sprite to the glass. Stir. Garnish with a lemon wedge.

In a large skillet, heat 2 tablespoons of the olive oil. Add the broccoli, cut side down, cover and cook over moderate heat until the broccoli is just tender and the water has evaporated, about 7 minutes. Add the remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil along with the garlic and the crushed red pepper and cook uncovered until the broccoli is just tender and the water has evaporated, about 3 minutes. Add the remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil along with the garlic and the crushed red pepper and cook uncovered until the broccoli is just tender and the

Cook the pasta in a large pot of boiling, salted water according to package directions stirring occasionally, about 8 minutes. Meanwhile, whisk the olive oil, parmesan cheese and lemon juice in a large bowl. Drain the pasta, reserving 1 cup of the cooking liquid. Toss the pasta with the lemon sauce, and add the reserved cooking liquid and toss again. Season with the salt & pepper. Garnish with lemon zest and chopped basil.

Preheat oven to 325. Combine cake mix, oleo, and 1 egg. Press into bottom of a 10x15 pan. Beat remaining eggs. Add cream cheese and powered sugar. Mix well. Stir in coconut and nuts. Spread over crust. Bake at 325 for 40-45 minutes until golden brown. Cut into squares.

Heat oil over medium heat. Add butter and, when melted, increase heat to medium-high. When oil-butter mixture is almost smoking, place cutlets in skillet, and fry until crisp and golden, about 2 to 3 minutes per side. Drain them on paper towels and fry remaining cutlets in same manner. You can keep them warm in the oven as you cook the rest.

Boil chicken, red potatoes, sweet potatoes, fresh green beans, mayonnaise, nonfat plain yogurt, milk, dill weed, salt, pepper, macadamia nuts, lettuce leafpreparation:Boil chicken, red potatoes, sweet potatoes, fresh green beans, mayonnaise, nonfat plain yogurt, milk, dill weed, salt, pepper, macadamia nuts, lettuce leafpreparation:Boil chicken, red potatoes, sweet potatoes, fresh green beans, mayonnaise, nonfat plain yogurt, milk, dill weed, salt, pepper, macadamia nuts, lettuce leafpreparation:Boil chicken, red potatoes, sweet potatoes, fresh green beans, mayonnaise, nonfat plain yogurt, milk, dill weed, salt, pepper, macadamia nuts, lettuce leafpreparation:Boil chicken, red potatoes, sweet potatoes, fresh green beans, mayonnaise, nonfat plain yogurt, milk, dill weed, salt, pepper, macadamia nuts, lettuce leafpreparation:Boil chicken, red potatoes, sweet potatoes, fresh green beans, mayonnaise, nonfat plain yogurt, milk, dill weed, salt, pepper, macadamia nuts, lettuce leafpreparation:Boil chicken, red potatoes, sweet potatoes, fresh green beans, mayonnaise, nonfat plain yogurt, milk, dill weed, salt, pepper, macadamia nuts, lettuce leafpreparation:Boil chicken, red potatoes, sweet potatoes, fresh green beans, mayonnaise, nonfat plain yogurt, milk, dill weed, salt, pepper, macadamia nuts, lettuce leafpreparation:Boil chicken, red potatoes, sweet potatoes, fresh green beans

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Saut onion oil until tender. Add garlic, and saut for 2-3 minutes. Stir in tomatoes, and cook only until tomatoes are warm. Use a large spoon to scoop the stringy pulp from the squash, and place in a medium bowl. Toss with sauted vegetables, feta, olives, and basil. Serve warm.

In a small bowl combine all of the marinade ingredients. Put the steak in a plasic bag. Pour in the marinade. Close the bag and place in a shallow baking pan. Marinate in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours or overnight. Preheat the broiler. Remove steak from bag and discard marinade. Place on broiling pan. Broil for 5-7 minutes on each side.
Drain and reserve liquid from fruit. Add enough water to make two cups of liquid. Pour pudding mix & liquid into a pan. Cook until thickened, stir in dry jello. Mix in pineapple and oranges. Chill.

Preheat oven to 180 degrees celsius. Lightly grease and line a 20cm cake tin and line with baking paper. In a bowl combine the flour, oats, bicarbonate of soda, allspice, sugar and pecans. Make a well in the centre and then add the oil and egg and then the apples and combine all ingredients well together. Pour mix into the prepared tin and cook for 35 minutes until golden brown.

In a large bowl, combine cream cheese, vanilla ice cream, chai tea mix, banana, milk, chai tea mix, banana, milk, chai tea mix, banana, milk, chai tea mix, banana, milk, chai tea mix, banana, milk, chai tea mix, banana, milk, chai tea mix, banana, milk, chai tea mix, banana, milk, chai tea mix, banana, milk, chai tea mix, banana, milk, chai tea mix, banana, milk, chai tea mix, banana, milk, chai tea mix, banana, milk, chai tea mix, banana, milk, chai tea mix, banana, milk, chai tea mix, banana, milk, chai tea mix, banana, milk, chai tea mix, banana, milk, chai tea mix, banana, milk, chai tea mix, banana, milk, chai tea mix, banana, milk, chai tea mix, banana, milk, chai tea mix, banana, milk, chai tea mix, banana, milk, chai tea mix, banana, milk, chai tea mix, banana, milk, chai tea mix, banana, milk, chai tea mix, banana, milk, chai tea mix, banana, milk, chai tea mix, banana, milk, chai tea mix, banana, milk, chai tea mix, banana, milk, chai tea mix, banana, milk, chai tea mix, banana, milk, chai tea mix, banana, milk, chai tea mix, banana, milk, chai tea mix, banana, milk, chai tea mix, banana, milk, chai tea mix, banana, milk, chai tea mix, banana, milk, chai tea mix, banana, milk, chai tea mix, banana, milk, chai tea mix, banana, milk, chai tea mix, banana, milk, chai tea mix, banana, milk, chai tea mix, banana, milk, chai tea mix,

Preheat oven to 450. Grease or spray a large cookie sheet. Stir together dry ingredients including the sugar. Cut butter into flour mixture. Add raisins, stir to mix well. Beat egg in measuring cup. Add milk to make 1 cup. Stir into flour. Drop roughly tablespoon size scoops on cookie sheet. Bake for 10-12 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit or 175 degrees celsius. Mix the flour, baking powder, baking soda, butter, sugar, egg, vanilla extract, cornmeal, baking powder, salt, flour. Add to the creamed mixture. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto a greased cookie sheet. Bake in a preheated 350 degree oven about 15 minutes or until lightly brown.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Place crust on an ungreased 14 in pizza pan. In a small bowl, combine cheese, mayonnaise, onion, garlic, oregano, salt and pepper. Spread over crust. Bake at 450 degrees for 8 to 10 minutes or until edges are lightly browned. Cut into wedges and serve warm or slightly cooled.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add cabbage, cabbage, celery, green pepper, onion, salt, pepper. Mix to combine and cook until the cabbage if crisp-tender and the liquid is reduced to a glaze. Season with salt.
Cook sausage until done. Add pineapple and brown sugar. Heat through. Add banana. Toss to coat and serve.

Heat oven to 400 degrees and line a baking tray with baking paper. Mix the breadcrumbs, sesame seeds, five-spice and a little seasoning on a plate. Pat dry the chicken, dip into egg, then roll in the breadcumb mix. Arrange on the baking tray, then bake for 25 to 30 minutes until crips and cooked through. Mix the soy sauce with the citrus juices and sogar to make a dipping sauce. Serve the chicken with little dishes of the sauce for dipping, plus lime wedges for squeezing over.

Preheat oven to 350f. Lightly grease a 9x13 inch baking dish. In a medium bowl, mix chile peppers and cream cheese. Stir in chopped turkey. Place the rolled tortillas, seam-side down, in single layer in the prepared baking dish. In a medium bowl, combine the salsa and beans. Spread about 2 heaping tablespoons of the chile pepper mixture on each tortilla, and roll up.

Melt chocolate in microwave on med. Power. Beat cream cheese until smooth. Gradually add sugar, beating until well blended. Add melted chocolate and vanilla, mix well. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Roll into 1 inch balls. Roll in nuts or coconut. Store in refrigerator.

Heat the oil in a saucepan. Add chicken and chilli mixture and cook on a low slow heat until the chicken is transparent. Add chillies to the chicken mixture and cook until the chillies are soft. Next, to the mixture in the saucepan, add the tamarind paste, fish sauce and the sugar. Simmer for ten minutes then turn off heat. Cool for a few minutes and then pour the mixture into a blender or food processor and blend until the mixture is the consistency of jam. Pour into sterilised jam jar and store in fridge. The chilli jam will last for a couple of weeks in the fridge.

Heat the olive oil in a large skillet or wok over low heat. Add the garlic, pine nuts and soaked raisins and cook till the nuts and the garlic are light golden, 3-5 minutes. Increase the heat to medium add the chopped spinach and cook for about 1 minute, stirring to combine evenly. Season with salt and pepper to taste, transfer to serving bowl.

Heat oil in a heavy 4-quart saucepan over med-high heat. Add in the onion, carrots, and celery. Cook, stirring, until the vegetables begin to soften, 2-3 minutes. Add in the split peas, broth, and water. Bring to a boil. Partially cover pan, decrease heat to med-low, and simmer until the soup is thick, about 45 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste. You can add fresh herbs. Fresh dill is recommended. Also can add meat and ham bones to make it richer.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Place tomatoes in a medium bowl. Set aside. In a small bowl, combine oil and vinegar. Add parsley, basil, oregano, salt and sugar. Mix well. Pour over the tomatoes. Cover and refrigerate for at least 3 hours. Drain. Serve on bed of lettuce if desired.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Combine potatoes and oil in a large bowl or plastic bag, tossing well to coat. Combine salt, garlic powder, red pepper in a small bowl. Sprinkle salt mixture over potatoes, tossing well to coat. Arrange potatoes in a single layer on 2 baking sheets coated with cooking spray. Bake at 425 degrees for 25 minutes. Turn potatoes over, and rotate pans. Baking an additional 20 minutes or until golden brown.

Heat oil in a nonstick skillet coated with cooking spray and cook tortillas for 6 minutes. Drain. Add hot sauce and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer, uncovered, for 3-5 minutes or until sauce is thickened and chicken is no longer pink in center. Place lettuce on warm tortillas and drizzle dressing on top. Roll up and serve.

Preheat oven to 350f. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line a greased 10 x 15 cookie sheet evenly with graham crackers. Combine brown sugar and butter and bring to a boil in microwave or on stovetop. Pour mixture over crackers and sprinkle with nuts and chips. Bake for 10 minutes. Cool in refrigerator. Cut or separate into bars.

Preheat oven to 350f. Mix together brown sugar and butter until smooth. Stir in baking soda, cinnamon, vanilla, and salt. Add eggs and stir until blended. Stir in oats, flour and raisins. Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls onto greased baking sheets. Bake for 25-30 minutes or ntil light golden brown. Cool completely in pan on wire rack.

Place cauliflower on a platter, cover with water and salt lightly. Bring to a boil and cook until easily pierced with a skewer, about 20 minutes. Drain and transfer to a serving plate. Mix oil, vinegar, salt and pepper, pour over potatoes and cauliflower, breaking them up a bit as you do. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Whisk the butter, sugar, salt, eggs, vanilla extract, unbleached all-purpose flour, baking powder, blueberries, buttermilkpreparation:Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Whisk the butter, sugar, salt, eggs, vanilla extract, unbleached all-purpose flour, baking powder,

Heat oven to 400 f. Combine the oil, garlic, sugar, cumin, salt, cinnamon, and carrots in a shallow baking pan. Roast 20 minutes or until fork-tender. Remove from oven and add the raisins, lemon juice, and parsley. Toss well.
Spread cheddar cheese across the serving plate. Spread mango chutney over all.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Brown beef and onions in skillet. Drain. Mix in tomato sauce, garlic and oregano. Place in a 2-quart casserole dish. Top with corn. Then spread mashed potatoes over the corn. Lay cheese over the mashed potatoes in a single layer. Bake for about 25-30 minutes or until the cheese is completely melted.

Preheat oven to 350-degrees f. Place salmon in 8-inch baking dish and set aside. In a small cup or bowl mix together next 3 ingredients and pour over salmon. Bake for 20 - 25 minutes or until cooked through. Sprinkle with salt, parsley and green onion.

Cover chicken with water in a large pot. Cook 1 hour and remove chicken. Meanwhile, prepare remaining ingredients, and add to pot after removing chicken, and cook for 1 hour. Meanwhile, place chicken in baking dish and roast it in a 350 f oven for 30 minutes. After roasting, let chicken cool for 10 minutes before removing meat from the carcass and adding the meat to the soup pot. Simmer until the meat is heated through, and serve.

In lg. Skillet, coated with nonstick spray, brown chops on both sides. Cook over medium heat till juices run clear. In a bowl, combine the honey, lemon juice, soy sauce, and garlic. Remove chops and keep warm. Add honey mixture to the skillet. Cook over medium heat for 3-4 minutes, stirring occasionally. Pour over chops.

Preheat oven to 350. Blend cake mix and pudding in a large bowl. Add eggs, oil and water. Start on low speed, then 10 minutes at medium speed once ingredients are throughly mixed. Turn batter into a 10 inch tube pan. Bake 50 minutes at 350 or until toothpick is clean. Cool in pan on rack do not turn upside down. Using a 2 tined fork, poke holes 1 inch apart in the entire cake. Prepare glaze mixing powdered sugar and milk til smooth. Pour glaze over cake immediately and allow to cool in the pan.

Heat oven to 400. Cover broiler pan or cookie sheet with foil and spread asparagus in one layer. Spray with cooking spray and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Cook for 12 minutes or less. Heat butter in a small skillet on low heat until lightly brown. Add vinegar and soy sauce. Pour over cooked asparagus.

In a large bowl, whisk the eggs and cream together. Gently fold in the cheese, pasta and rest of ingredients. One at a time, in that order. In a nonstick pan, heat the oil over medium heat. Pour the egg mixture into the pan and cook for 7 to 8 minutes until the edges start to brown. Flip the frittata by sliding it onto a large plate or tray then carefully inverting it back into the pan. Continue to cook for 5 to 6 minutes more. Remove from pan then cut into wedges and serve. This is delicious served warm or at room temperature.

Stir boiling water into gelatin in large bowl at least 2 minutes, or until completely dissolved. Stir in cold water. Pour into smoothie molds or plastic or paper cups. Freeze about 2 hours or overnight until firm. Insert wooden spoon or stick or plastic spoon into each for handle. Freeze 8 hours or overnight until firm. Insert wooden spoon or stick

Slice avocado lengthwise. Remove pit and scoop avocado into a small bowl. Add mayonnaise, lime juice, worcestershire sauce, hot pepper sauce, garlic salt. Stir and mash the ingredients together until guacamole is preferred consistency. Serve immediately, or cover and refrigerate if desired.

Wash and drain spinach leaves, removing any thick stems. Slice onions, tomatoes and red peppers into strips. Heat oil in a saute pan. Add onions and peppers and cook until wilted. Add tomatoes and cook. Crumble bouillon cubes into pan and add spinach with whatever water clings to the leaves. Cook until spinach wilts. Season with salt and white pepper, to taste.

In a large bowl, combine the dried navy beans, roma tomatoes, english cucumbers, onion, parsley, oregano, olive oil, red wine vinegar, hard-boiled eggs. Season with salt and pepper. Add beans, bread, tomatoes, cucumber, onion, parsley, oregano, olive oil, red wine vinegar, hard-boiled eggs. Toss to combine. Cover and refrigerate at least 2 hours, and up to 8 hours. Just before serving, stir in basil.

In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add onions and brown sugar to the skillet. Saute and stir frequently for 15-20-30 minutes or until meatballs are well heated. Stir as needed. My family enjoyed these meatballs over noodles.

Wash bok choy. Cut stems and tops into about 1-inch pieces. In a large bowl, combine last 7 ingredients and mix well. Add bok choy to the dressing and toss to coat. Place in a hot wok or large pan and stir-fry over med-high heat for about 8 minutes or until desired tenderness is reached.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Place tomatoes on a rimmed baking sheet, cut side up. Drizzle with oil, and sprinkle with thyme leaves. Season with salt and pepper. Roast until tomatoes begin to collapse, brushing occasionally with pan juices.

Combine lemon juice, lemon juice, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest,

Preheat oven to 350f. In a large mixing bowl, beat butter, brown sugar and margarine until light and fluffy. Add vanilla and eggs. Blend well. Add flour, baking soda and salt. Mix well. Stir in chocolate chips. Drop dough by rounded tablespoonfuls 2 inches apart onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 350f for 8 to 10 minutes or until light golden brown.

In blender, combine chipotle chiles in adobo, lime zest, red onion, garlic cloves, cumin, ground coriander, kosher salt, extra virgin olive oil, flank steakspreparation:In blender, combine chipotle chiles in adobo, lime zest, red onion, garlic cloves, cumin, ground coriander, kosher salt, extra virgin olive oil, flank steakspreparation:In blender, combine chipotle chiles in adobo, lime zest, red onion, garlic cloves, cumin, ground coriander, kosher salt, extra virgin olive oil, flank steakspreparation:In blender, combine chipotle chiles in adobo, lime zest, red onion, garlic cloves, cumin, ground coriander, kosher salt, extra virgin olive oil, flank steakspreparation:In blender, combine chipotle chiles in adobo, lime zest, red onion, garlic cloves, cumin, ground coriander, kosher salt, extra virgin olive oil, flank steakspreparation:In blender, combine chipotle chiles in adobo, lime zest, red onion, garlic cloves, cumin, ground coriander, kosher salt, extra virgin olive oil, flank steakspreparation:In blender, combine chipotle chiles in adobo, lime zest, red onion, garlic cloves, cumin, ground coriander, kosher salt, extra virgin olive oil, flank steakspreparation:In blender, combine chipotle chiles in adobo, lime zest, red onion, garlic cloves, cumin, ground coriander, kosher salt, extra virgin olive oil, flank steakspreparation:In blender, combine chipotle chiles in adobo, lime zest, red onion, garlic cloves, cumin, ground coriander, kosher salt, extra virgin olive oil, flank steakspreparation:In blender, combine

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Preheat oven to 350. Grease 2 small loaf pans, or 1 large one. Stir sugar, butter, eggs, bananas and buttermilk in large bowl. Stir in flour, baking soda, and salt. Stir in blueberries, pour into pan. Bake large pan for 75 minutes, smaller pan from 55-60 minutes. Cool for 5 minutes, remove from pan onto wire rack, cool 2 hours before slicing.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Brush a large baking dish with 2 tablespoons of the olive oil. Put green beans, onion, and garlic in dish, drizzle with remaining oil and sprinkle with salt. Bake for 25 minutes, stirring beans at least 3 times. When tender, remove beans from oven and transfer to bowl. Immediately drizzle with vinegar. Add hearts of palm, tomatoes, pine nits and pepper to taste and toss. Serve warm or room temperature.

Heat oil in a large saute pan or saucepan over medium-high heat. Add onion and garlic. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 10 minutes or until vegetables begin to soften. Add carrots, celery and onion. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 10 minutes or until vegetables are soft. Add lentils to soup. Cook for 5 minutes or until heated through. Sprinkle with parsley and squeeze lemon juice. Season with freshly ground black pepper.

Preheat oven to 350f. Peel, core and slice apples. Place in a well greased 8x8-inch baking pan. Mix cake mix, oats, sugar and cinnamon in a large bowl. Melt butter and pour over the top of the dry cake mixture and mix until crumbly. Sprinkle this over apples. Bake for 1 hour or until top is golden brown and apples are tender.

Cook linguine montecatini just until done. Trim green onions and cut lengthwise into long thin threads, including green tops. While noodles are cooking, heat butter and sesame oil in a large skillet. Stir in green onions. Cook for 1 minute or until onions are wilted. Add soy sauce, ginger and garlic powder. Add drained pasta, toss well and serve.

Cook the tuna in a large pot of boiling salted water until tender but still firm to the bite, about 8 minutes. Meanwhile, combine the tomato sauce, tuna, capers, and lemon peel in a heavy large skillet. Using a fork, break the tuna into chunks. Simmer to blend the flavors, about 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper, to taste. Drain the pasta, reserving 1 cup of the cooking liquid. Add the tuna to the sauce and toss to coat. Toss the pasta with enough reserved cooking liquid to moisten. Stir in the parsley and serve.

In a large mixing bowl, combine apples, lemon juice, lemon zest, maple syrup, dates, sesame seeds, lemon balm. Beat on high speed until soft peaks form, about 4 minutes. Spoon into dessert dishes, cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving. Garnish with additional whipped topping if desired. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion and cook for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add garlic and cook for another 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add salt and pepper and cook for another 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add salt and pepper
Mix all ingredients together well. Bake 1 hour at 350.

Heat oven to 425. Place chicken breasts in ungreased baking pan, 9 x 9 x 2. Spread 1 tsp butter on each of the four chicken breasts. Sprinkle salt and paprika on the breasts. Drizzle all with the lemon juice. Bake uncovered 35- 45 minutes or until tender. Sprinkle with snipped parsley and serve.

Preheat oven to 350f. Toast oatmeal in a shallow pan for 10 minutes to brown, watch carefully. Remove from oven and in small mixing bowl combine oatmeal with remaining ingredients. Press into 9-inch pie plate. Fill with desired filling and bake or bake crust empty for later use.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Grease 12-cup muffin pan. Set aside. In a large bowl, combine spaghetti, eggs, parmesan cheese, and pepper. Evenly press mixture into muffin cups to form a crust. Evenly top each cup with pasta sauce, then mozzarella cheese. Bake 15 minutes or until bubbling. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 350. Place stick of butter in 9x13 size casserole pan and let sit in oven during preheating to melt butter. Mix flour, sugar, milk and vanilla with blender until well mixed. Pour batter over melted butter. Pour fruit and juice evenly over batter. Bake for 1 hour. Serve warm with ice cream.

Heat oil in large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and cook until onion is translucent, stirring occasionally. Add tomatoes with their liquid, pinto beans, lima beans, brown sugar, salt and water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer 15 minutes or until tomato beans are tender, stirring occasionally. Stir in white kidney beans, heat through. To serve, ladle soup into warm serving bowl. Sprinkle with 1 to 2 ounces shredded cheddar cheese if desired.

Spray a large frying with cooking spray then cook the chicken until no longer pink. Mix in the water, taco seasoning, & salsa, simmer for 5 minutes. Add in the cheese then stir until melted. Turn off the heat & stir in the sour cream. Spoon the chicken onto the tortilla shells, top with the tomato & lettuce, if using.

In a large pot, combine chicken broth, eggs, parmesan cheese, italian parsley, salt and pepper. Cook over medium heat for 1 minute, or until sizzling. Add chicken broth, eggs, parmesan cheese, italian parsley, salt and pepper. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Simmer, uncovered for 15 minutes. Reduce heat

Preheat oven to 350.
